document.heading: Targeted Historic Preservation Assistance Amendment Act of 2006

history.narrative: Law 16-189, the “Targeted Historic Preservation Assistance Amendment Act of 2006”, was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 16-300, which was referred to the Committee of the Whole. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on May 2, 2006, and June 6, 2006, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on July 31, 2006, it was assigned Act No. 16-473 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review. D.C. Law 16-189 became effective on March 2, 2007.
